1.title: Episode #4.1

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

1.plot: Simon enters the secretive world of research and development at Starbucks. Adam explores the latest trend in bottled water. Sophie sips cocktails and the team look at restaurant apps.

2.title: Episode #4.2

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

2.plot: Simon unlocks the science of what happens to our taste buds during air travel. Adam explores food mashups such as sushi burgers and cronuts. Sophie looks at motorway services food.

3.title: Episode #4.3

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

3.plot: Simon reveals the best restaurant special offers and proves that plenty of big chains are willing to give away food and drink for free. Also features a report on which are the healthiest chips.

4.title: Episode #4.4

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

4.plot: Adam reveals the simple psychological trick used on menus to get diners to spend more. Simon explores healthier new food trends. Sophie asks if fruit juices are as healthy as people think.

5.title: Episode #4.5

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

5.plot: Can Seyi Rhodes revive a meat dish that has fallen out of favour? The team explore the impact of social media on restaurants - from the power of TripAdvisor to online ordering from your restaurant table.

6.title: Episode #4.6

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

6.plot: Sophie explores the latest developments in the battle between coffee and tea for hot drink dominance. Eating out for breakfast and the amount of salt in some desserts are also looked at.

1.title: Episode #1.1

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

1.plot: The series begins by looking at burgers. How different are the patties used in high-end burgers from those that McDonalds serve? Plus reports on restaurant sales techniques such as up-selling and the 'golden table'.

2.title: Episode #1.2

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

2.plot: The team compare classic pizzas with less traditional alternatives - checking their nutritional values. Afternoon tea is examined and the team ask how much restaurants make by rushing diners?

3.title: Episode #1.3

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

3.plot:

1.title: Episode #2.1

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

1.plot: The show that investigates whether consumers are getting the best deal at their favourite eateries returns, finding out just how good the coffee really is at high-street chains.

2.title: Episode #2.2

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

2.plot: The team go behind the scenes at a leading high-street sushi chain, where Kate Quilton asks how healthy the Japanese cuisine really is. She also examines what ingredients go into wasabi paste.

3.title: Episode #2.3

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

3.plot: The team look at what is in some of the takeaway lunches sold by big name chains and investigating whether the salads and soups that many order as a healthier option are quite as healthy as we think.

4.title: Episode #2.4

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

4.plot: Kate Quilton enlists the help of a group of taxi drivers to investigate why portion sizes seem to have got bigger. Simon Rimmer campaigns to bring the doggy bag to Britain to reduce the amount of food waste.

1.title: Episode #3.1

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

1.plot: Sophie reveals why "fresh" and "handmade" don't always mean what we think. Simon explores how coffee chains are changing what we drink.

2.title: Episode #3.2

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

2.plot: Sophie investigates children's menus. Simon discovers that fish and chips isn't as British as you may think. Plus cinema dining menus and the disappearance of the 125ml wine glass.

3.title: Episode #3.3

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

3.plot: What does the growth of home delivery companies mean for consumers and restaurants? Simon exposes hidden sugar is restaurant dishes. Single-dish restaurants are examined.

4.title: Episode #3.4

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

4.plot: Sophie gets some fans of the traditional British-style curry to try out the new wave of authentic Indian restaurants with are opening in the UK. Also, a look at how important restaurants have become to shopping centres.

5.title: Episode #3.5

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

5.plot: Simon checks out the high-street trend for dessert bars. Why does American fast-food taste different on each side of the Atlantic? How do you undress a lobster?

6.title: Episode #3.6

episode of.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (TV Series 2016– )

6.plot: Sophie tries out a healthier and cheaper steak - the flat iron steak. Simon meets the former builder who is the only British pizzaiolo in Italy's exclusive True Neapolitan Pizza Association.

imdb.title: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade
akas: Tricks of the Restaurant Trade (United Kingdom)
plot: 'Kate Quilton' (qv) and chef 'Simon Rimmer' (qv) investigate how consumers can get the best experience when dining out.::Mark_a_Wood <markawood@hotmail.co.uk>
